greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The integers (shown from -50 on).
comment: The first 101 terms are the central 101 terms of the integers.
The reason for including this entry is to provide search results for sequences of the form -k, -k+1, -k+2, ... for small positive k.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,-1).
program: (PARI) vector(101,n,n-51) \\ In the spirit of other "programs", but actually the result does not have offset -50. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 19 2015
xref: See A001477 for the nonnegative integers and A000027 for the positive terms.
See A001057, A130472 for other enumerations of the integers.
The first 101 terms are the 50th row of triangle A196199. - _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 14 2015
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_ and _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 14 2015
ext: Revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 19 2015 at the suggestion of _M. F. Hasler_
